title: Ukraine: Russia has attacked schools and hospitals, says deputy PM
description: Meanwhile, the UN says more than 1.5m people have now fled Ukraine since Russia invaded on 24 February.

title: Ukraine war: Residents run from Russian shelling in Irpin, near Kyiv
description: People are seen dropping to the ground as the town, just outside Kyiv, is attacked again.

title: Protests across Russia see thousands detained
description: People have been held in 53 cities, from St Petersburg in the west to Vladivostok in the east.

title: Shell defends 'difficult' decision to buy Russian crude oil
description: The oil giant confirmed it made a purchase of Russian crude oil on Friday but said it had "no alternative".

title: War in Ukraine: Russian invasion fuels Finnish support for Nato
description: President Putin's devastating attack on Ukraine leaves countries in the region worried about their future.

title: War in Ukraine: Zelensky urges Ukrainians to go on the offensive
description: In a rallying cry, the Ukrainian president says the country has withstood the invasion "together".

title: War in Ukraine: Thousands march in Kherson against occupiers
description: The Black Sea port is Ukraine's only big city to have been captured by Russia in the war so far.

title: Queretaro v Atlas: At least 22 injured as fans fight at Mexican match
description: At least 22 people are injured as violence breaks out among the crowd at a top-flight match in Mexico.

title: Putin says sanctions over Ukraine are like a declaration of war
description: The Russian president also warned against any attempt to impose a no-fly zone over Ukraine.

title: Ukraine invasion: Residents under siege in Mariupol clear out shopping mall
description: Local officials say residents are in dire need of food, water and medicine due to Russia's blockade.

title: War in Ukraine: Citizens evacuate town of Irpin as homes are destroyed
description: Crowds are leaving the town of Irpin outside Kyiv as Russian shelling strikes residential areas.

title: Why Indian fathers are embracing paternity leave
description: The pandemic and changing family structures have highlighted how young parents are struggling with childcare.

title: BBC Ukrainian editor: 'My mother called to say she'd managed to buy bread'
description: In the second week of war, the BBC's Ukrainian editor says empty shelves are an increasing reality.

title: From Grozny to Aleppo to Ukraine, Russia meets resistance with more firepower
description: Russia answers resistance with big guns and sieges. Ukrainians pray that will not happen to them, writes the BBC's Jeremy Bowen in Kyiv.

title: The young Ukrainians battling pro-Russian trolls
description: Conspiracy theories and trolls are adding to the chaos of war.

title: European peace seems as fragile as ever
description: The shifting of European history's tectonic plates is not really that unexpected, explains Kevin Connolly.

title: Why doesn't Ukraine attack the Russian convoy? And other questions
description: Correspondents and experts answer questions from readers on the BBC News website

title: Russia oligarchs: The mega-rich men facing global sanctions
description: President Putin has for years warned Russia's richest to protect themselves against sanctions.

title: Ukraine war: Don't be afraid of Putin, Kyiv residents say
description: This couple in Kyiv tells the BBC they are confident that Ukraine will survive Russia's invasion.

title: War in Ukraine: Russian helicopter shot down by missile
description: The video, shared by Ukrainian armed forces, shows the helicopter being hit by a missile.

title: Ukraine war: President Zelensky invites Elon Musk to visit
description: Ukraine's president was thanking the tech entrepreneur for supplying Starlink equipment to the country.

title: War in Ukraine: Thousands of pro-Russia Serbs march in Belgrade
description: Flags and flares are paraded through the Serbian capital, as marchers show support for Moscow.

title: Ukraine: Russians still bombing Mariupol despite ceasefire - deputy mayor
description: Serhiy Orlov tells the BBC that attacks are still happening despite a ceasefire being agreed.
